name: Cold Spider (Dreamlands)
appearance: An enormous, pallid spider-like entity native to the Dreamlands, far larger and more grotesque than its weakened real-world counterparts. Its body is covered in thick chitin, its many eyes gleam with unnatural intelligence, and its movements are both deliberate and unsettling.
personality: Alien, solitary, and vicious. Despite possessing intelligence, cold spiders do not cooperate with one another and may even prey upon their own kind. They act purely according to predatory instinct and self-interest.
background: Cold spiders originate in the Dreamlands and are associated with the Spider God Atlach-Nacha. In this realm they exist in a far more powerful and primordial form. Some legends speak of truly colossal specimens, dwarfing even normal Dreamlands cold spiders.
goals: Hunt and feed on prey encountered in the Dreamlands
Serve the broader, inscrutable designs of Atlach-Nacha
secrets: Cold spiders may cannibalize one another
There exist exceptionally gigantic cold spiders beyond the norm

clues.clueText: Dreamlands cold spiders are far stronger and more resilient than those encountered in the waking world.
Some cold spiders grow to truly gigantic size, inspiring far greater terror.

relationships.description: A distant but absolute patron entity tied to the spiders’ existence.
relationships.history: Cold spiders are creatures associated with the webs and designs of Atlach-Nacha in the Dreamlands.

notes:
Combat & Abilities:

Combat Style:
Although cold spiders possess intelligence, they do not cooperate with one another and may even engage in cannibalism. A bite injects deadly venom. Rumors persist of extraordinarily gigantic cold spiders. Each cold spider attacks once per round.

Attacks:
• Bite – 40%: Deals 1D3 damage plus venom. Venom POT equals 1/5 of the spider’s CON.

Combat Maneuvers:
• Web Projection – 60% (Entangle): Targets must succeed in a STR vs STR contest to escape. The effective STR of the web equals half the spider’s SIZ.

Armor:
6 points (thick chitinous shell).

Spells:
Roll 1D20; if the result is lower than the spider’s INT, the Keeper selects 1D3 spells for the spider to use.

Sanity Loss:
Seeing a cold spider causes SAN loss of 0 / 1D10. Encountering a truly gigantic cold spider increases this to 1 / 1D20.

Keeper Notes:
Dreamlands cold spiders are apex predators and should be treated as major threats rather than minor encounters.
